admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second
            Telecommunications Project for Laos were as follows:
            outcomes were highly satisfactory, project sustainability
            was likely, Bank performance was highly satisfactory, and
            Borrower performance was also highly satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: despite infrequent Bank
            supervision missions, the beneficiaries substantially
            exceeded the project's physical targets and implemented
            institutional reforms well beyond the project's
            original scope. Specifically, changing the specifications
            for the long-distance transmission system from fiber-optic
            to microwave increased long-distance capacity by 15 times at
            a lower cost, with acceptable quality. Flexibility in
            specifications permitted the beneficiary to capitalize on
            technological advances that enabled it to greatly exceed the
            project's original physical targets. Given the
            Government's interest in commercializing the economy,
            and the telecommunications sector in particular, the Bank
            could have provided more support in sector reform, notably
            by supervising the project more regularly and encouraging
            the Government to adopt a more competitive market structure.
